decks.notes: This deck aims to disrupt opponents with hatebears while applying aggressive pressure. By utilizing cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent's spells, while also playing efficient creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer to apply pressure, the deck can control the game tempo. The inclusion of disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine further adds to the deck's disruptive nature. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying threats to close out the game quickly.

This deck is focused on controlling the game through various counter spells and removal cards, as well as utilizing the Gifts Ungiven card to search for key cards in the deck. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by consistently disrupting their plays while setting up powerful combos with cards like Underworld Breach and LÃ³rien Revealed. The inclusion of the Companion card, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, provides additional value and flexibility to the deck's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's powerful spells and ensure consistency in casting them.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo using cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Doomsday itself to set up a winning sequence of cards. It includes protection in the form of Force of Will, Force of Negation, and other counterspells, as well as card advantage with Ancestral Recall and draw spells like Brainstorm and Gush. Thassa's Oracle serves as the win condition once the combo is assembled, allowing the player to win the game on the spot. The deck is focused on efficiently executing its game plan and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gaining incremental advantages. It includes a mix of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Black Lotus to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value over the course of the game. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent through efficient spells and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on using the combo potential of Paradoxical Outcome, along with various mana acceleration tools like Black Lotus and Moxen, to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion of key cards. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and counterspells to protect the combo pieces. Overall, the key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.
